author: Fernando de Diego
comment: Really very good. many years ago I wrote a Visual Basic application for iPaq (Archery Logbook) with many many things equals to this app.  This one is very well done, its easy to use, fast to record shots, and provides very useful information. I Like very much the ability to record the order and the number of the arrows then you can see groups made by arrow, and/or shooting order. You can improve your shooting, fine tune your equipment, and adjust your sight scope much better and precise. Using this application correctly makes your training sessions double efficiency. Thanks for this contribution to archery and.... When is going to be available for IOS devices too?

author: Darryl Fitzgerald
comment: Great app! Very good for tracking your progress and easy to use. I recommend this app for new and experienced archers! 10/10 aka X

author: Lance Burkholder
comment: Great app to keep scores on. Able to customize almost everything and tracks your progress. Love it

author: Steve Kratz
comment: Excellent for archers. Keeps perfect records of practice sessions!

author: J Man
comment: Any chance you guys could make a vitals on an animal with an 11 ring 10 outer 8 then 5 for the body? That could help for out 3d practice

author: Kiran Sapkale
comment: Best app ,It works.Very usefull .

author: Phil Coates Palgrave
comment: Great app but doesn't show 6 ring target for compound no matter what I do

author: Neringa Siugzdinyte
comment: Bloody amazing!

author: Stefan Hee
comment: The best.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks :)

author: THE SLOW MOTION KID
comment: The best app ever

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks :)

author: Mike Gonzales
comment: You can take notes for rounds, not ends. You can't really record yardage. You can record yards if the whole event is the same distance, but for 3d (marked/ unmarked/ rangefinder ok) it is impossible to record your performance at different distances.  Recommended fixes: notes for every end, ability to record marked distance for every end.  Update: How do you reset arrow #s I keep more arrow in my quiver than are used per target and I would like to keep track of individual arrow performance Still waiting on variable yardage.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your valuable feedback! Everything you have said is already planned for future releases :). Update: I didn't forget variable yardage, but I had to focus on my research recently and hence didn't find any time to push development forward. I hope the feature makes it into 2.6.0.

author: Ben Ramsey
comment: Love the app so far. The only problem I have is that the arrow size will not change on a custom round. I could not find a 300 round 5 spot round so I made a custom one and all my arrow holes are pin holes even though I have .390" arrows selected. The arrow size works on the Vegas round that I found though. Other than that it works great.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback! The arrow sizes are drawn relative to the size of the target face. So I guess you have selected a 5 spot target face with a huge diameter. Drop me an e-mail if you need further assistance or it still does not work with a smaller target faces ;-)

author: Steven Gøhler
comment: I love the app. However, after I updated it, I am now forced to input a arrow number each time I try to insert a value. Is it possible to turn this feature off? If not, I would love if you could implement it.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content:
Hi Steven,
Sure, just uncheck the "Arrow numbering" option when you create a new training. The checkbox is placed below the arrow selection.

comment: Great app. With full control over targets, distances, style and timer there is a bit of a learning curve to this app but well worth it. Packed with great features and much more than an electronic score card, especially the desperation pattern.

author: David Berrill
comment: This is a brilliant app! So useful with good analytics and great selection of every archery round and target face you can think of. Florian is a great guy - I emailed him this morning with a bug I'd noticed in some scoring on the new version and he's emailed me within an hour to say he's working on it and within a few hours to say it's all fixed. Great support for a free app so be sure to make a donation to keep this developing! Can't wait to go and shoot again now!

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for the bug report! I'll look into it soon.

comment: Just wanted to update this, as I've been using this app at the range. It works brilliantly. It's fast and simple to use while shooting, so other archers aren't waiting around for you and you can maintain your "zen". It also records the arrow positions, which is much more useful to look through afterwards than just numbers. This was definitely the right app to choose.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your review! Glad to hear :)

author: Cajun Prosser
comment: First day using this app and getting back into archery. Bit of a learning curve but very straight forward. One thing i would love to see though would be an option to set distances ( simillar to arrow selection ) if your ranges are unkown and for tracking purposes be able to see groupings by range. Maybe seperate colored circles around the two farthest shots for each range ? Other than that amazing app keep up the good work. Oh and a port to IOS.  Update: Noticed the new grouping features in the most recent update while practicing on 115 targets. Amazing job! The choices for grouping worked perfectly to show exactly what was needed to help improve my shots! Cant wait for the next update. One thing that we noticed was it would be helpful to be able to flip the 3D targets as not all targets face the same direction.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content:
Thanks for the feedback!
Setting unknown distances before entering the results is already planned. Would it be sufficient for you to see the groupings in the statistics or would you expect to be able to do this in the input screen?
iOS port will probably not happen in the near future. I would have to do this full-time instead of spare time ;-)

author: Mark Searle
comment: The app is ok but I am a little disappointed by the android wear support. This was the main thing I wanted so I could quickly record my training scores but it seems to decide to change to a timer before I finish the first round and the only way to get the number options back is the go on the app itself which defeats the purpose really. That said it's free and obviously had some hard work out in and if you don't need android wear support is a great app.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Hi Mark, Thanks for your feedback! The current beta version has a much better Android Wear support (still not perfect, but I'm doing my best). Please try it and let me know what you think 🙂 (btw the countdown appears as soon as you have entered the specified number of arrows)

author: David McKenna
comment: Nice looking and useful app to help with scoring. I can think of 2 improvements that would help: 1) the ability to score multiple archers (especially if you can arrange the order they appear) and 2) mark the misses in a colour that does not already appear on a target face - I suggest green!

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content:
Thanks for your feedback!
1) is planned and 2) is probably a good idea ;-)

author: Duarte Vicente
comment: One of the most complete Archery scoring apps that I tried. Put a dark mode in the app and it will make it way less battery consuming and easy to look at.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback! I'll consider adding a dark more ;-)

author: Daniel Hinman
comment: The only thing I feel is missing is a way to explain what I'm looking at after I shoot for the day. I don't understand the arrow Ranking system.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content:
Thanks for your feedback!
That's definitely something I want to improve in the future. The arrow ranking sorts your arrows by their standard deviation/group size. So arrows archiving consistent small groups are ranked top. If you have further questions don't hesitate to ask in the beta testers group ;-)

author: Doug Johnson
comment: Amazing app, I've recently taken up archery and it has been an effortless aid! The only improvements for me would be: -The ability to scale scoresheet to paper size when printing to pdf -Toggling Imperial/Metric scoring on some rounds (may already be there but I couldn't find it)

author: Pnumatix
comment: Nice app. My main archery recording data base. Any chance of a print option for bow and arrow record pages in the future updates?

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: It's planned 😉 https://github.com/DreierF/MyTargets/issues/281

author: Heinrich Helmbold
comment: Great app for practicing and capturing your progress. All the stats are there and entering scores are super easy. Would love to see a "pro" version of this app that can be used in actual comps where scores are similtaniously captured on multiple devices and sent to a master device in a Google Sheet. Awesome work guys!

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your review! Multiple archers are already planned, but I can't promise any release date any time soon.

author: Julia Allegrini
comment: Love this app. However am I missing something in that I can't add notes to first round or overall session?

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your review! You can add comments to rounds by long pressing on the round and selecting edit. But the next major version gets the ability to add comments to trainings, rounds and ends and will make it a lot easier accessable.

author: Christopher Copley
comment: Perfect. The effort and expertise that has gone into producing this app is obvious from its user friendly interface, fluid simplicity of use and its many built-in functions.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks for your review 🙂

author: Lori Cano
comment: This is amazing. I have never had such a great understanding of my progress. It also allows me to double check my scores in competition.

author: BeeGee1305
comment: Amazing little app. Does every kind of scoring you would ever need. Also let's you keep track of your equipment very easily. Definitely is the best archery scoring app on the market. Highly recommend!

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: Thanks :)

author: Matsui Ran
comment: Perfect | edit: It's been more than a year since I started using this app. And no-app can beat this!! Keep up the good work.

author: Simon Paterson
comment: Great app. Easy to use. Just started using it and was the only person using it at my club, but that won't be the case next week. Lots of interest from other club members.

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: I'm glad to hear that :)

author: sidiq athfaludin susandi
comment: Kenapa di handphone saya (moto G) tidak bisa melakukan input score melalui layar dispersion pattern. Hanya bisa melakukan input lewat keyboard. Tolong feedback...  Update : Permasalah sy sudah d respon dan skarang sdah bs d pakai lagi.ad kesalahan ukuran arrow yg saya input

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: If you have any issue please contact me via Email. I won't be able to help you here in the reviews. And if possible please answer in English :)

author: leigh philip Hadfield
comment: Would be a 5 star but missing the function to find out your personal best for each standard round. Hopefully that can be added??

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: It's on my to-do list, but didn't have time yet to implement it ;-)

author: Randy Dodson
comment: I've used this app for months and it has really helped me tune my bows and my form. Always aim for the gold...

author: Gavin Evans
comment: Great way to record important sight markings and keep an archive of scores. Thanks

author: el jefe
comment: Super useful and lots of features for personal performance tracking. Awesome app!

author: Julia Schroeder
comment: Really nice app! What is missing is the ability to have two or more people!

reply.author: Florian Dreier
reply.content: That's planned, but will take some time ;-)

author: Raihanamazing Channel
comment: Yeah I use this and it's super Cool it's help me to manage my score

author: Eka Hadi Pramono
comment: Very usefull application for an archer...Thank you

author: Upu Rasmijaya
comment: The best scoring apps, period
It's great
